website_summaries.verdict: The many innovative and user-friendly features of the Roomba i7 and its companion base ensure a clean floor whenever you need it.
pros: Has 10 times the power of a Roomba 600
Automatically recharges and empties its dust bin
cons: The only drawback is its high price

customer_reviews.title: Wait until they fix the problem
customer_reviews.text: We are returning the unit because the right bumper keeps getting stuck even after getting a second unit from Roomba. Don't Waste your money on this until they fix the problem. We have only had about 12 runs on each unit until it stops working because of the senor problem under the bumper.
customer_reviews.author: Smurfette12

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work a single day
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving it the robot prompted me to update the software. However the robot was stuck updating. Several calls later to customer support I was told to take the battery out , push these two buttons or three buttons to no avail. Finally they said we will escalate it ( who knows what that means ). Regardless please don’t waste your money on this. I certainly didn’t expect to spend thousand dollars on a product that didn’t work one day or encounter customer support which was not responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Faraz Khan

customer_reviews.title: Beware non disclosure of information
customer_reviews.text: The website stated that the robot self empty after its cleaning and I don’t need to remember about cleaning for weeks. But for the past 2 weeks since I installed it, it never completed its cleaning. The robot never self empty it. I had to use the app to empty it. Another thing the website does not say is that your phone/app has to be on the same WiFi in order for you to control it. My purpose of getting this was for my college daughter who is living on her own. If I can’t check on it or control it from a different site, it defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Don’t rate often

customer_reviews.title: A total dud!
customer_reviews.text: I never take the time to write a review, but I could not be any more disappointed in this machine. I have been on the phone with customer service 3 different times. One time for 45 minutes and two other times for 30+ minutes. It hasn't worked for 3 weeks, and now they are telling me that they are waiting on a software update to resolve this problem. It spins one direction and turns around and starts spinning the other direction, but it DOES NOT clean the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed...WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE
customer_reviews.text: Absolute piece of overpriced garbage. Ran ONE time for ten minutes then battery crapped out after unit had been in charging base overnight. Had to take apart the battery assembly on the $1000 POS to due a manual reset per tech phone service. Ran again for maybe 15 minutes. I stupidly thought by buying the most expensive model they have would have kept me from having problems with the machine but now I’ve just got a ugly conversation piece sitting in the corner of my living room. STAY AWAY...
customer_reviews.author: RHW.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised. Does not save time.
customer_reviews.text: This product is awful. It leaves dog hair clumps all over the floor. It also does not suck up the dirt off the floor. It has gotten stuck under furniture several times. It took several hours to do a 2,000 square foot house, and had to recharge like 4 times to do it. It ran out of battery when it got stuck, so I had to go pick it up and put it back on the charger. It said I had to empty the bin, when the bin was already empty. It knocks things over. It is taking more time to keep it running than it was saving me in cleaning time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thorough
customer_reviews.text: The first unit was sent back to the manufacturer as it failed on the second use and would not reset. Customer service at iRobot were very helpful. The second unit is working well so far and it is a good tool to have. It does not manage to complete the house (2,180 sq.ft. mostly tile) in one sweep and needs to recharge midway through. With the recharge the job takes over three hours but it is effective. Still quite new to this so I am still not fully decided on the value of this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: The lazy persons vacuum. Live it
customer_reviews.text: Had a neato it failed and I had to return it so I brought this one . I brought it cause it emptied it self which was a mega plus . Pricey but so far well worth it .quiter than the older version and I like u can name the rooms . Working great so far fingers crossed . Named mine John Mclean.alexa works great with it and the self emptying bin is worth it so once a month I change the bin bag . I run mine everyday. It will not work at night unless u have the lights on . I set mine to run when I am at work. Love it so far
customer_reviews.author: elizabethrees

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy It - it breaks and iRobot won't fix it
customer_reviews.text: The product worked well for a couple months. When it stopped working I tried to get get support from iRobot. After a month of troubleshooting and sending pictures of the robot stopping in the middle of a hard wood floor, they finally agreed to replace it. Once I sent them the receipt, they wouldn't honor their warranty because it was bought via Amazon but not through their store or a seller they approve of, even though it came brand new from Amazon. Follow up to the above, Amazon made it right and accepted my return even though it was past 30 days. I shop almost exclusively through Amazon because of customer service examples like this.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a roomba before but not one this expensive. I’ve never been so disappointed. I’ve had so many issues with it. It’s had issues charging. Now it keeps saying the brushes are blocked when they aren’t. I’m ready to get rid of it or return it and get either a different brand or something.
customer_reviews.author: Juliana Osipov

customer_reviews.title: Great when working not sure it will last. Hate re-mapping.
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum works great when not having errors of some kind. I hate having to factory reset because of a camera malfunction and have to relearn the map. Should be able to save a map and load it in after the reset. Not sure how long she will last as I've only had her a couple months and already having problems. Ordered replacement parts already. My daughter's long hair cut right through a green tube wheel the first day.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Had One of These Before I Retired
customer_reviews.text: Single retired old man... I really like my Roomba. The dog and cat not so much but as long as it is mild outside I don't mind them spending a few hours outdoors. I have a single story 1900 sq ft home with multiple surfaces (wood, tile, area rugs and carpet). Smaller rugs need picked up but it does a pretty good job in covering all areas. It takes one or two battery recharges (each one about 90 min) to cover the home but I'm not in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: D. Downs

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 7 months. Waiting for resyfrom seller. Will update this when resolved.
customer_reviews.author: bob matthews

customer_reviews.title: Biggest waste of money! Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: This incredibly expensive product barely picks up small clumps of dust or bits of dog hair. The few things it does pick up, it later spews out somewhere else in the apartment. A broom and dust pan would be more efficient. The only reason I gave 4 stars to Tech Support is that when I called for help getting the robot to empty the dust bin, the tech support person was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Problems every week!
customer_reviews.text: Every week, I have to call customer service because there's a different issue with this vacuum. Customer service is really awful because they take so long and it sounds like they don't know what they're doing and they're reading off a script. Every time I call customer service, it's at least an hour to get results. This time it took over an hour and they still didn't fix the problem. Two thumbs DOWN!!!
customer_reviews.author: See Why

customer_reviews.title: Robot great...app terrible.
customer_reviews.text: The robot itself is fantastic. The app is a glorified pile of junk. I spent weeks with customer service changing router settings and sending them pictures and videos only for the same result everytime. The mapping feature will only work if you can somehow get connected to the cloud and then stay connected to it. I had to reconnect the robot every time I wanted to use it. I finally sent it back because I was sick of babysitting the robot while it cleaned everytime. Junk junk and junk.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, but was disappointed it uses bags.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mother as a mothers day present. I was worried it wouldn't clean great given its size vs a normal vacuum. However, it may even get the floors cleaner than a regular vacuum. Set up took about 10 mins, and was super easy. I also have a very old sick cat i was concerned would get run over, but it was gentle enough to not hurt him. My only problem is the dirt disposal stand doesn't use a canister, it uses small, expensive, and wasteful bags. After spending over one thousand dollars on this i was a little disappointed i have to keep buying bags when every other vacuum nowadays uses canisters.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: awseome
customer_reviews.text: i put this at my ranch where have a ton of traffic, dirt coming in and out. super easy to setup. like 5 minutes. ran it when i left for weekend. came back floor looks best it has in long time! even better than my maid service. super easy to use with ap on iphone. i give it a ten stars!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Robot, But... (read this now!)
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great it mapped out my home and vacuumed flawlessly. Until my base stoped charging my robot. So I called tech support at iRobot, they had to send me a new base. That was fine it was supposed to be around 2-5 weeks, 6 month later still haven’t received my new base and I get back order reminders every night. I have called but they say that they can’t do anything. At this point the should have sent me a whole new robot. Very disappointed, my 1,000$ of technology that was awesome has been sitting doing nothing for 6 months. I still would recommend this product, just my situation is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Was impressed until I wasn't.
customer_reviews.text: Great at picking up hair from our Golden Retriever. Very loud when emptying the dust bin. Constantly hits my dog's food and water bowls even though we put the electronic boundary RIGHT NEXT to both bowls. Daily, if not more frequent, alerts that this or that is clogged or inhibiting the robot from completing the task. Not sure why or what is causing the scratching, checked all the areas where it goes and haven't been able to identify what is gouging the top of the robot. It supposedly SEES what is close by, but it will stay in one location for MINUTES bumping a wall or other obstacle. I have to manually move it to another position.
customer_reviews.author: Ripper11

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. We had an issue with the robot and an issue with the base. Tech support was terrible
customer_reviews.author: Eric E Setzer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We use Roomba almost daily due to pet. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: qzkhtw

customer_reviews.title: clean base only compatible with 110v
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 240v country. this is available for me to purchase and i am unable to use it without buying a USD300 step down converter. this should be stated at purchase or made not available to 240v countries. wonderful waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Buying my second one for a downstairs room
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer! I’ve owned one other iRobot vac and one other brand. I liked my first one but this one takes it to another level. I walked into the kitchen and said ‘Alexa tell iRobot to vacuum’ and that was it. I watched it empty itself twice, yes the floors were that bad for my test run. When it was finished I got a notification on my phone and turned on the mop robot! I’m done being the house maid while living with 2 dogs, 2 sons, and a husband who isn’t handy with a broom.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: You name it, so you will keep it
customer_reviews.text: Just like a pet, they have you name the vacuum so you will keep it. Not 20 days after I purchased this unit, a brand new model came onto the market. Really ticked me off honestly. Of course, Irobot will tell you they will exchange your I7+ for the new model, if you purchased in the last 6 months, but NOT if you bought it on Amazon. So now I'm stuck with an old model, that does meh work.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly S.

customer_reviews.title: Like iRobot
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this robot. I especially like the self-cleaning option so I really can run it on a schedule and not have to empty the bin each time. Initially, the tech support could not figure out why I could not connect my phone. I had to restart my router, uninstall and reinstall the app. Finally it was connected and I was able to set up a schedule. This is my best Roomba yet - since it also gets stuck less in places my other two Roombas used to get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Unhappy customer

customer_reviews.title: We love our new family member!
customer_reviews.text: So happy I finally bought this! It took “Rocky” about two runs, for upstairs and downstairs, to learn the layout. It’s insane how well he mapped the place out and how efficient he is with the path he chooses. Tried out the no go zone today and it worked out great. We have 7 cats in the house bc we foster and we have a 5 year old boy, so having the extra help is amazing. I have it scheduled to go to certain rooms more than others throughout the week, which is awesome. I also like how you can choose the order it goes to each room. So far, it’s worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: Deena

customer_reviews.title: Roomba S7+ Performance w/Dog Hair
customer_reviews.text: I should say lack of performance. This Roomba is great on hardwood floors and will capture the dog hair. On carpeting however, even after three runs on a low pile rug, the Golden Retriever hair is simply balled up by Roomba in clumps. I could probably have saved a lot of money with a cheaper model Roomba for the hardwoods and stuck to my Dyson Animal vac for the carpets. Waste of money. Do not believe the advertising that it handles dog hair. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine M. Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and get started. The robot worked for the first time out. Then developed error 26, which could not be fixed. Called iRobot 3 times. They were helpful, but not responsive. 2nd time I called, they escalated the problem to a tier 2 technician and that they would call me with solution. 2 days later no response. I called once again, magically the technician sent a response while I was talking to the 3rd person. At any rate, they are replacing the cleaning head module. I am sure a refurbished one. So I spent more time on the phone than this thing spent cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Appelman

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This turd stopped working within 2 months of purchasing. Worked fine since We opened it new on Christmas. Then my girlfriend unplugged the base to move it to a different wall (4 feet from the modem/router) and now it won’t connect to the WiFi or communicate with the app. I’m 15 days outside of the return window so now I’ve got a $700 vacuum that doesn’t work. Awesome! Support as of now doesn’t have an answer. We’ve been told twice they’d research the issue and get back in touch with us.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: HARDWOOD FLOOR BUYERS BEWARE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would love love love to give this product a 5 Star Review but honestly I cannot. It does a great job in cleaning up debris. Didn't have to use a broom for a couple of weeks. However, I noticed circular scratch marks...MULTIPLE circular scratch marks on my HARDWOOD floors in my living room. Hardwood floors in my bedroom were fine. Maybe different floor types? In any case, that's a BIG NO for me. Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Dhannie Vorbe

customer_reviews.title: Junk, junk, junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk, didn’t even clean 100 sf and already has had 2 issues, won’t charge properly and now the vacuum won’t work error says need a new filter. Really it’s brand new and cleaned less than 100 sf and needs a new filter. One expensive piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saves Time
customer_reviews.text: I love this robot. We have approx. 1800 sq foot home to vacuum. Pick up all items on the floor before you run unit. We, at first had errors the first couple of days. After we figured out we needed to keep a light on in each room (we run Hazel at night), she is flawless and works as designed. I am not a fan of the app, but it is an adequate tool. I will update again after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: njoynaz

customer_reviews.title: Just a Poorly Built Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that has failed miserably. The return window closed 4 days ago and now the red light is on an will not go off. We have replaced everything replaceable except the wheels which seem to work on this one (the front wheel broke on the first one we returned). We have cleaned every sensor, followed all the instructions, and now we have $700 paper weight. I had my first Roomba for 4 years. I do not know what has happened to the quality but it is a poor product. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Dock
customer_reviews.text: Product works great...for a while. Then it started having docking issues. I would find the robot stopped in the room or stuck on the dock like shown in the picture. It can't see the dock. I cleaned it the best I knew how. I called tech support. They blew me off. Tried calling again and got a representative that told me a needed a software update. OK? So she said it would update that night. It did not. You never get answers with these people when you try and fix something. They act like you did something wrong or you are docking the robot in a very weird spot.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with some thicker/deeper/longer strand carpets
customer_reviews.text: The i7+ would move about but would get "clear main brushes"/"error 2" errors and stop about every 5 minutes. Basicly, our shag carpet with sparse multi-thickness strands some as long as 1.5" would fool the i7+ brush resistance sensor into thinking there was too much hair or something wrapped on the brushes. It would do this especially when spin turning. This is according to iRobot support after I sent them up close pictures of the carpet with a coin for scale. So I recommend confirming compatibility with IRobot if you have more challenging carpets even for the top of line most powerful Roombas.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: This has changed my life!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of same product. I had one for the downstairs and now i have one for the upstairs. By running this regularly, I have freed up my weekends to do fun things. It is amazing how well it picks up on both carpets and hardwood floors. I LOVE this model because it learns my rooms and then efficiently cleans - no longer bouncing in all directions( I had an earlier unit too). I love that it empties itself, will recharge and go back and finish. It knows where it has been so picks up where it left off. For all busy working folks - this investment will give you your weekends back! Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jean Barchet

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife, happy life.
customer_reviews.text: My wife complained to me, fairly, about how much I do not help her around the house. So I said I would handle the vacuuming every week. So I bought this Roomba because I knew I was not going to keep that promise. I can honestly say this is the BEST $800 I ever spent. It does a fantastic job cleaning up. We have a long hair cat that sheds a lot and it picks up the hair with no problem. To the guys out there; make your wife happy and save yourself the trouble. Get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: life happiness up 100%
customer_reviews.text: This robot has given me an hour and a half of my life back by be NOT having to vacuum the house 3 times a week due to our pets. i still vacuum weekly but its just spot maintenance. life happiness up 100%
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very mobile, finds a way to get stuck on anything in your house
customer_reviews.text: After having this for awhile now, it is a huge disappointment. It gets stuck on everything and anything and completes it's cleaning maybe 10% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: I have a Newfoundland dog.
customer_reviews.text: If you don't know what a Newfoundland looks like, I'll quickly summarize: hairy. Dog hair tumbleweeds used to plague my house. This thing has done wonders for keeping our home clean. The automatic bin emptying feature is a must for pet owners. Most of our house is hardwood and it does a phenomenal job at collecting pet hair. On the carpeted areas it's not as great, often leaving clumps of hair on the carpet, but those are easily picked up by hand. I would highly recommend this product for someone with pets and hardwoord/not carpeted floors.
customer_reviews.author: Emem

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is totally awesome! It knocks out your whole house and you can program it to clean your floors when you want it to. The convenience of it emptying itself is great and saves a lot of time. We have tiled floor so we don’t know how it works on carpet but with two dogs in the house we don’t have any hair or any debris from their paws brought in. It is so worth the money. You can even program it to vacuum certain areas of the house more often than others. It’ll change your life lol.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: Much improved over prior models
customer_reviews.text: As a previous owner of an 800 and 600 series Roomba, room mapping is a massive improvement over random travel. The suction dock is also a major step up in automation over prior models, as the bin will fill frequently even on small jobs. Suction isn't great, but the robot excels at day to day maintenance cleaning and is probably sufficient on hard surfaces. I wouldn't expect it to deep clean carpet or remove fine hair. Otherwise, this is a great tool to keep the home clean all week, particularly if you have little ones or furry ones tracking debris around often!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not a Five, But Close
customer_reviews.text: By far, the absolute worst owners manual I have ever tried to get through. And unfortunately, calling customer service didn't provide any useful information. Besides that, I would have given the product a five. As a professional engineer, I find the device addictive to watch. It gets into and out of places I would have bet money on that it couldn't. Watching it "think" it's way around a cluttered room is amazing. And after it parks itself, you realize the floor is clean. Time and use will hoping answer ALL of my questions about CLEAN lights and what they actually mean. Until then, the worse owners manual ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonrockskcsworld

customer_reviews.title: Best investment in tech, ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this new Roomba. Had a 600 series for years, and was pleased with that. This one blows that one off the map. This one keeps backing up over a spot until it's clean. Adjusts from tile to thick area rug easily (that would perplex the 600) and cleans them both beautifully. It's also noticeably quieter than the old one. Automatic emptying of the debris bin was the drawing feature (which it performed very well), but the way it maps the house tells me it's much smarter than the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Oz Gudorgen

customer_reviews.title: This iRobot is amazing but awesome with deep cleaning and dog hair.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a Shark iRobot but with a dog that sheds a lot we would need to dump out all the hair about ever 10 minutes so this auto dirt disposal option sounded good at first thought it was a little pricey but it's worth ever cent. Doing spring cleaning took everything from underneath bed and first used my Meile canister and vacuumed as much as possible. Ran the iRobot in the room and I was amazed how much dust and dog hair it got. We knew it was good on hard floors but never thought it would do that good on carpet....Love this ...would recommend it to anyone with or without a dog.
customer_reviews.author: Cece

customer_reviews.title: By Far The Best Purchase I Have EVER Made
customer_reviews.text: You need one. My wife freaked out I bought one but boy is this thing helpful. I can make a complete disaster in the kitchen and tell it to clean up the Kitchen. Oh and do it twice just cause and then empty your own filter. DONE! This saves me so much time over the old Roombas which unfortunately are still working. (sarc)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R

customer_reviews.title: 30 minutes then.........nothing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife as a Christmas gift. Set up was easy and it started right up. All told, it ran for about thirty minutes. Then today, it refused to work at all. Kept throwing an error that the right wheel was stuck. Went through all the troubleshooting steps. Sat on hold for forty minutes with customer service and then was told they were sending a new wheel module. Seriously? Works for only thirty minutes and then needs to have a wheel replaced?
customer_reviews.author: Heidi M. Sallee

customer_reviews.title: Since Last Update to App, Roomba is Useless.
customer_reviews.text: Since the last update my Roomba is no longer seeing the “Do Not Enter” zones and is driving into sliding glass door channels. When I go to the app to fix, the map I worked on so long to almost perfect was no longer the same map. I’m guessing it attempted to migrate my original map into the new format which is now almost impossible to work with. I am unable to zoom out any further than one room at a time, can not see the entire map. All of my “Do Not Enter” zones are either missing or moved on the map. I now hate my iRobot Roomba, a wasted $800.
customer_reviews.author: R Res

customer_reviews.title: Mine was a dud out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had to send this back because right out the box it consistently gave the error code that it needed a new wheel. I did all the recommended troubleshooting tips and nothing worked. Also, it would not leave the dock without assistance and after helping it, it would spin in circles till it stopped and give the wheel error code. I got this to NOT have to mess with a vacuum. This needs way to much assistance. I'll stick to using my Swiffer.
customer_reviews.author: Coppertop69

customer_reviews.title: Returning
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum just didn’t cut it for me. I ran the thing multiple times and it just didn’t preform at all picking up dog hair. Not worth the money. It has to go back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does not work 100%
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt work with bravia and away from home. It sends a message saying cloud issues. I contact technical support and they try to help me,it worked for a week but now the problem is back. Now its worst because there is No communication at all away from home or at home with the cloud and Bravía Irobot.... I call them again, and they told me that they are working in a new upgrade but for now they can not help me....
customer_reviews.author: Coca

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Roomba vacuum. My floors always look clean. I will say my border collie has long hair that wraps around the rollers horribly. And it does struggle to pick up dog hair off rugs. I have to clean off the rollers almost daily. That said, I still recommend this vacuum. Saves me so much time cleaning. It’s my first Roomba, it will not be my last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade to the 980 series. It is amazing how quiet it is compared to the older models. I had to actually check to see if it was sucking, it def was! The mapping feature is much better as well and I love the ability to map the rooms out in my house. This model also finishes its job in about half the time as the 980. My 980 took about 5 hours for 1000SqFt and the i7 takes about 2.5-3hrs. Expensive product but worth the money if you can swing it!
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work half the time, doesn’t do what it’s supposed to the other half.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes when I bought this vacuum. It has turned into frustration and disappointment. When it does work it does an ok job. Just ok. About half the time I tell it to do a job it will not do it or just do part of the room it’s supposed to do or just start running into the wall saying it can’t get to that room. The maps it makes are constantly changing even though I have continuous mapping off. It’s an absolute waste of money. The vacuum I had for 6 years before this was a neato and I never had a problem with it until it finally died after 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey S.

customer_reviews.title: 3 Months in. Fantastic. Must have. 2 cats.
customer_reviews.text: We had a normal Roomba before this that worked ok. Mostly it would bounce around and suck up some of the hair and litter on the wood floor. I was very hesitant to purchase this very expensive roomba but it was an excellent purchase. It mapped the house after a few days cleaning under the beds that had an embarrassing amount of dust and cat hair. I have a specific zone set to clean around the litter box and I can tell Google assistant to do that for me.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: NO SUCTION!
customer_reviews.text: The irobot was a waste of $700. It couldn’t even pick up crumbs on my wooden floor. The suction is absolutely terrible. When I reached out to support, they were very unhelpful. Luckily I’m within the 30 day warranty and I’ll be returning my iRobot to purchase the Shark version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: So many flaws. Won’t even start vacuuming when you physically press clean, much less use app or voice control. They can’t build a real robot, I have no idea why not. Great concept poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a rainbow vacuum and love it. Life has gotten so busy that I am not able to vacuum as much as I need to with a dog in the house. I purchased the I7 Roomba to vacuum in between when I can get my big vacuum. I have had it for a couple of months and I have yet to need to get he big vacuum out. I love the power and the convenience!!
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Best Roomba ever
customer_reviews.text: I have a owned two other Roombas and this one is the best of the best in every way .reliable... efficient... powerful and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Let Me Clean That
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Set up a cleaning schedule and it starts on schedule, returns to empty it’s bin and to recharge. Setup on 2nd floor of raise ranch, gate at stairs. Very independent. Rarely needs help, but will send text if stuck or needs help. Have been using for 3 weeks, cleaning 6 rooms and long hall, 3 times per week keeps the dog hair under control. Plus also clean on demand. Recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We call him, Wall-E
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to set it. There are practical limits. It can get stuck, eat a wire or a shoelace, and bump into things a little harder than I want. Those things being said, this is a fantastic version. It is durable enough to deal with most obstacles.
customer_reviews.author: Disciple

customer_reviews.title: "Wakes up" for no reason with a loud alarm noise
customer_reviews.text: It does a fine job of vacuuming and emptying the bin automatically, However, for no reason the circle light turns red, the unit make a loud alarm noise that stops after trying many times to push on the start button and hoping for the best. Very annoying when it happens at 2 am, I then feel like putting the unit in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Skalli

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing. Just get it.
customer_reviews.text: First robot anything for us... And it's absolutely amazing. Our tile floors seemed to stay dirty no matter how much we swept. It was a constant fight with grit. This thing is a game changer. We running every other day and our floors stay spotless. It's literally stunning how well this thing cleans. We have a small house, so it was mapped after only two runs. It cleans every nook, cranny and corner. Tile and rugs without issue. Only catch is to make sure you don't have floor clutter. Cords and loose clothing will hang it up. Otherwise, sit back and enjoy the smooth, clean feeling of grit free floors.
customer_reviews.author: AvidConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Set it up for hardwood floors and forget about it
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was cool for about a week. Now? Well, I forgot it’s even there. I just realized today that I never have dirty hardwood floors anymore needing my attention.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney J Lancour

customer_reviews.title: Roomba i7
customer_reviews.text: i7 is a huge upgrade from our old 560. It’s mapped out our house and usually makes it back to the dock. The vacuum base works very well also! It’s able to unstick itself from underneath furniture and toe kick’s. It’s obviously an investment but if you have the house for it I would say it’s a good option as opposed to running a swiffer all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bean

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the ridiculous price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second iRobot. The first, an i6, was not too smart, cleaned well, and cost 1/3 price of this i7. It would often jet lost or run out of power before finding it’s charging station. The i7 maps the house and and cleans in predictable patterns. It will return home to charge itself when feeling rundown and will empty the bin when full before returning to it’s job. Well worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Martin R.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! Don't get knock off brands.
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a Roborock S5 and it was supposed to be great with hair, it was not. Had to unclog the brush 2-3 times per run. My Roombas have been flawless at dealing with hair. They also deep clean better as when I ran my Roomba 980 over same area the Roborock just cleaned, it picked up a ton of dirt and hair. Stick with Roomba and you will not be dissapointed! The i7 is very quiet and does a great job! Just do it and don't look back!
customer_reviews.author: Heather R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent robots !!!! I don’t know how I managed without them! Worth every penny and the customer service has been excellent at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Davidson

customer_reviews.title: IRobot missed the mark by MILES
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it WORKS! However in the few short months I’ve had it iRobot has had to send me a new motor head & a new battery. Now the motor head is out again. They refuse to replace the unit, I have to send it back to them for them to repair and send back to me. Basically I get a refurbished unit now. I’m really annoyed. I asked for a new unit and was told no. They won’t take it back either. My old (14? Years?) Roomba is still going strong. This one is a $1000 hunk of trash and not backed by a company who gives 2.... Guess I’ll buy the Shark one to try.
customer_reviews.author: SuperBookNerdAK

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work / broken within 3 days / don’t waste your $$ or time
customer_reviews.text: Had this top of the line With emptying station @ $1100 with all necessary accessories for 3 days and bang it stops working correctly My husband calls CS and basically gets told that it needs a new battery !!! WTH this item is less than 3 days old. So disappointed and now returning it for full refund to amazon ( thank goodness they are easy to deal with !!) This is absurd and big waste of $$ We were really looking to this item delivering excellent service and CS.
customer_reviews.author: muriel duggins

customer_reviews.title: won't connect to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: To get the Roomba i7+ to connect to WiFi, I spent three hours trying all the troubleshooting tricks noted by users at various sites. I then spent an hour on the phone with their customer service representative the next morning. She was friendly and had several recommendations, all of which I had tried the previous night. I nevertheless tried them again with her, and they failed. I should note that my WiFi setup is not at all unusual. How can a company sell an $800 robot vacuum cleaner without testing it against standard WiFi systems?
customer_reviews.author: khammer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We have three dogs and two cats and for years I've used a Samsung Powerbot vacuum, but I had to be on hand to empty it regularly and it frequently got tangled on our antique rugs and needed to be rescued. This device is amazing. The extra bin lets it go solo without needing my attention, it glides over my rug fringe without doing damage and yet somehow it is doing a better job cleaning. I think the twirly brush really helps because its able to get in corners and under counters where my old vacuum couldn't . I spent weeks looking at consumer reports and amazon reviews before getting this and so far it was worth every dollar.
customer_reviews.author: William Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Not good for pet hair on carpet
customer_reviews.text: Product is not good for removing pet hair on carpet. I was thinking perhaps a defective unit so I returned for replacement only for the replacement unit to operate precisely the same. It rolls up pet hair like a cigarette and drops it in a different location. CONSISTENTLY. Says 10x power but it sure isn't suction power. It is very quiet though, and it is a good idea. It worked great on my hard floor surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford H. Boss

customer_reviews.title: A time saver
customer_reviews.text: It's been almost a year and I don't regret this pricey purchase. There are things that annoy me, yes, but overall it's a good vaccum and I'm happy to not be the one doing the work. I wish more replacement parts were available separately versus only in packages and for not so much money. It's unfortunate we've already had to change out the rollers, corner brush, and filter. We have one dog (who doesn't shed a lot compared to others), one cat, and four females with long hair in our household.
customer_reviews.author: A.W.

customer_reviews.title: My floors are constantly clean
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest vacuum ever. Where do I even start? The smart mapping feature along with the Alexa integration is wonderful. Drop some crumbs in the kitchen while cooking? Just ask Alexa to send the roomba over and clean it up. Suction is excellent, gets the wood, carpet and tile floors. The self-emptying is so convenient. I've had the unit two months now, ran it 100 times, and still haven't had to change the bag in the base. I would say the only draw back is that the filter in the dust bin has to be cleaned every couple weeks or so. Seems like it is constantly dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac E

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Buggy from day one. Had to disassemble to pull battery to reset often, and even then it often just would not start to clean. Smart Maps didn't work right, constantly erroring over bogus map mismatches. Would frequently stop mid-job for no reason, not know where its base was, and require multiple resets. A cheap sub-$200 no-name competitor outperformed this expensive lemon on every front. Do not waste your money on this debacle.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS MACHINE.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought another one for my friends. I have 2 dogs, 2 long hair cats, and i come home covered in horse hair. I hate vacuuming so i bit the bullet. It did a deep vacuum yesterday. Twice around the house. And it goes right over to its base and empties out the Roomba. My floor is totally hair free. It’s worth every penny. If this keeps up, i’m getting the mopping one next. You will not be disappointed if You get one!!!! It’s just genius. I LOVE IT!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: 123Go

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Works great and really go through all different floors and keep it really clean. I'm giving 4 stars becaseu sometimes it doesn't go back to the dock station properly, stoping in somewhere randon and a couple of times it lost connectivity with the app and you need to restart the app to start the cleaning or schedule. Works fine with Nest hub, but you can only ask to vaccuing and you cannot set schedule or ask to pass in an specific place of your house.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Henrique Pinto Castilho

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas investment to myself ever!
customer_reviews.text: I got this on a cyber Monday deal. I was a little skeptical since I have a dog and pretty plush carpets. It took it a couple days to fully map out the house but now we have an amazing weekly cleaning schedule and it does a fantastic job! It also has made my 2 year old “clean up” the floor before the roomba gets going. I couldn’t have asked for a better x mas gift!
customer_reviews.author: Suad Bisogno

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: The software requires you to use your phone to operate it and it doesn't work properly if your home has more than one level. I find myself having to use my $200. manual vacuum to finish cleanup. Not what I expected to have to do after spending so much money. Not a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Eldridge Ellis Williams

customer_reviews.title: not at all what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to buy this, but quickly was disappointed roomba gets stuck virtually anywhere, it doesn't have a clear path when cleaning therefore missing lots of spots...overall I'm disappointed with how it has been working since I haven't saved any time with hiuselhold cleaning because I still have to sweep after it runs
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Henrich

customer_reviews.title: Great for households with no pets
customer_reviews.text: I have a Roomba 960, which does a great job on hardwood floors, but not so great on the carpet areas. So I bought the i7 hoping for better performance, particularly with the pet hair. Unfortunately, it does not perform well at all on pet hair. Balls it up and leaves it on the rugs, or it winds around the rollers and needs to be removed daily. The automatic emptying function is great. And it does a good job on hardwood floors. But the pet hair remains a problem.
customer_reviews.author: cmgism

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Was very hesitant with buying a roomba in the 1st place, my wife and I are very pleased with the outcome. After a lot of research I figured the i7 would be the best one for our household because of the little bit of extra suction power for our hardwood floors and because of the way it tracks and maps. Since I've had this thing I have not had to sweep but only go over with a wet mop once a week or so. I have a German shepherd, a long haired dachshund,and a short haired dachshund and and it gets all the hair up.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan M.

customer_reviews.title: beware of training and time to get it to work right at the begining.
customer_reviews.text: when I first bought I-robot vacuum... lets just say I had some problems. it kept getting lost so training is the key i have had it over a month and the maps are still not the key but it does not get lost anymore. The Cleaning is really great, I have 3 dogs, so dog hair is and issue. I do also recommend that you by the invisible wall as well. The tower Is great I have emptied the tower bin once when the vacuum called for it but it runs by it self. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: How long do I have before I can return it for a replacement unit?
customer_reviews.text: It has a few kinks I am waiting to see if they work themselves out before I may need a replacement unit, after cleaning a few rooms it tells me to clean the bin. I do and it keeps telling me to clean the bin. I keep cleaning it but there's no dirt left, so I replaced the bag with the spare bag it came with and it has worked well since. I love how clean it leaves my carpet throughout my home and tile kitchen floor. I need to find out how long I have until I can replace it if I kep having the same problem with the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: My house feels like a new home!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I didn’t listen to the bad reviews! I have 2 50lb dogs who shed a lot. I have the Roomba set to run every day and it feels like I have a brand new house! The bin works perfect every time. I hope it lasts forever!
customer_reviews.author: Aly Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Roomba we've owned. The first made it more than 5 years. Love this one. Quieter, "smarter", picks up hair without a complaint, gets over the lip between hardwood and tile floors. The ability to have a map and assign it to vacuum just a room is terrific. We've got a big house and it typically takes a full battery charge plus to get everywhere. Roomba runs till it needs a recharge; goes "home" and empties the dirt; recharges and finishes the job. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Flynn

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum cleaner, except the base won't charge the battery very well. I have just purchased my 3rd unit because IRobot can't ship a new base to me under warranty. The battery only lasts about 3 months. If this new unit doesn't last longer than that, another review will be written! If I wasn't so heavily invested into this unit with the additional warranty, bags, brushes etc. I would buy a different brand. IRobot will talk to your for hours ( more than 7 in my case ) but solutions are impossible to find. Buyer beware!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Gould

customer_reviews.title: God I wish it worked but it’s dumb as a dodo
customer_reviews.text: Had it for one day. Started mapping out the house but then got stuck under my armchairs and drilled away until it trashed our $5k Berber carpet and Turkish rugs. Caused permanent damage before we could stop it. If you got cheap floorings it’s probably not a bad deal to save you an hour or two but if you have any expensive rugs or carpet’s do not touch any of these automatic vacuum cleaners. Even the most expensive ones are a long way from safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: returned the item NOT WORTH the money
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not worth the money. Returned this item A swifter is much better. Kept getting stuck, would not go back to the base and would not automatically empty as advertised. Does not pick up animal hair, moral to the story, don't be lazy buy a swifter and that only takes 5 minutes to do
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken the 3rd day of purchase and wont work in carpet
customer_reviews.text: Definitely is smarter than the previous model but it broke on the 3rd day. The rollers are really weak. Also is very bad on carpet, does not have good suction power. I returned. I wish i keep my 980 unit.
customer_reviews.author: zeuspr

customer_reviews.title: Takes setting up the Map to make life easier
customer_reviews.text: The first couple of times the Roomba cleans, it's like a crazed hamster running around the floor. It will find all of the places where it can get stuck, so can be initially disappointing. Once it gets your home mapped, you can use the keep out function to it keep it out of troublesome areas. These areas will need to be done the old fashion way. We have one place where the carpet was raised up, so it can't climb out. I have to put a piece of cardboard down to make a ramp when it's going through this area.
customer_reviews.author: Dahtah

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about this device but after using it for a month must say it's pretty impressive. I's only gotten stuck twice but the app makes it easy to zone out areas you don't want it to go into. It isn't perfect but damn close. I'm not sure about the longevity of the batteries, motor, etc but hope it will run trouble free for at least a year. I'll probably buy another for the garage and have suggested it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Smarter than my dog
customer_reviews.text: Works great on its own. Works great with the iRobot app. Works great with google home. Not having to empty the bin at all is worth the extra couple hundred. As I walk out the door I just say “hey google, tell Jarvis (my roomba’s name) to clean the living room” and I get a notification on my phone when it finishes its task. Could only be better if it could climb stairs and open baby gates, but I think that’s asking too much.
customer_reviews.author: Chung Leung

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Generally disappointed. It’s definitely an in between cleaner and heavens above will smite you if you think it’s going to take care of long dog hair. We have a husky and a pug, and while it does a good job on the flat surfaces of the tile in the dining room, kitchen, and bathrooms and the hard wood in the bedroom and family room, it’s horrible on the short carpet and area rugs. I’m constantly getting alerts that it’s stuck or a wheel isn’t turning or it needs the brushes cleaned. It has also managed to wedge itself under the couch multiple times and gets stuck magically halfway under it with nothing around.
customer_reviews.author: Stasha

customer_reviews.title: great alternative to just having to vacuum, period!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. A little more than wanted to spend. Works all on its own and covers the entire first floor of my home. Never have to worry about chasing it down to empty the dirt container like the old one used on 2nd floor. Would never be without it. Can't wait until the one upstairs dies. (darn, should watch what you ask for...since not ready to purchase another one due to expense!)
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum! Love the self-emptying!
customer_reviews.text: The Roomba I7 does a great job of self-emptying and a good job of vacuuming. It finds its way around most obstacles and doesn't get stuck too much. While it is much quieter than a regular vacuum, it would be nice if it were quieter. The app is ok. I highly recommend this Roomba.
customer_reviews.author: Willt

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: We are obsessed with this Roomba. We have a cat and a German Shepard collie who sheds like a mofo. The Roomba will self empty twice in our 900 sq ft home. It’s loud enough that I wouldn’t have it running throughout the night, but if I had a second floor I totally would. When it empties itself it’s quite loud, but totally expected that. The only time the noise is comparable for a regular vacuum is then and it lasts 20 seconds max. I highly suggest this for pet owners. I was really skeptical at first because of the thick hair that falls off my dog in shedding season. Now I’m a belieber.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Smith

customer_reviews.title: It's great, when it works.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this product for months and its consistently ending its job stuck, clogging over the smallest debris, or just stopping in the middle of the floor. Just get a decent Shark vaccum and do it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Red F.

product_meta.title: iRobot Roomba i7+ (7550) Robot Vacuum with Automatic Dirt Disposal-Empties Itself, Wi-Fi Connected, Smart Mapping, Works with Alexa, Ideal for Pet Hair, Carpets, Hard Floors, Black
product_meta.description: Style:i7+ with clean baseThe Roomba i7+ robot vacuum automatically empties into a disposable AllergenLock bag that holds 60 days of dirt and dust - so you don’t have to think about vacuuming for months at a time. The premium 3-Stage Cleaning System and Dual Rubber Brushes provide powerful cleaning, guided by smart mapping technology that learns, maps and adapts to each room. Added control from your smart phone gives you a truly custom clean.
feature_bullets: CLEANS UP AFTER YOU, AND ITSELF - Forget about vacuuming for months at a time with the CLEAN BASE Automatic Dirt Disposal that allows the i7+ to empty itself for up to 60 days. AllergenLock Bags capture and trap 99% of pollen and mold.
POWERFUL PERFORMANCE & POWERFUL PICK-UP - Pulls in stubborn dirt & messes with a Premium 3-Stage Cleaning System & 10X the Power-Lifting Suction.

GUIDED BY SERIOUS SMARTS - With vSLAM navigation, the i7+ learns the layout of your home & builds personal Smart Maps, enabling it to expertly clean & navigate in neat, efficient rows. If it’s running low on battery, it recharges & resumes cleaning.

VACUUMS MESSES IN THE MOMENT - Cleaning crumbs is now as easy as “Roomba, clean under the kitchen table.” A simple request to your voice assistant or via the app enables the i7+ to clean messes for you, right when they happen.

COMPLETE CONTROL OF YOUR CLEAN - With Smart Mapping, your robot knows your kitchen from your living room, so you can decide where it cleans & when. With Keep Out Zones, your robot knows to avoid sensitive areas like pet bowls or play areas.
A CLEAN UNIQUE TO YOU - The Roomba i7+ robot vacuum is smarter than ever, learning where & when you normally clean & suggesting personalized schedules so you can focus on everything else.

IDEAL FOR HOMES WITH PETS - Unique Dual Multi-Surface Rubber Brushes don't get tangled with pet hair. Brushes adjust & flex to stay in constant contact with carpets & hard floors. High-Efficiency Filter traps 99% of cat & dog allergens.
THE DREAM TEAM OF CLEAN - With Imprint Link Technology, the Roomba i7+ robot vacuum & Braava jet m6 robot mop team up to vacuum then mop automatically in perfect sequence.

ALWAYS GETTING SMARTER - Quality that lasts. Intelligence that grows. Equipped with advanced hardware capable of providing the intelligent features you love today, & access to our latest advancements in the future.

iRobot does not certify the quality or authenticity of products purchased from non-authorized resellers, and will not cover claims, provide service or offer replacements for products purchased from these sellers.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,597 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: 1 Dual Mode Virtual Wall® Barrier, 1 Extra High-Efficiency Filter, 1 Extra Side Brush, 1 North American Line Cord, 1 Roomba® i7+ Robot Vacuum, 1 Clean Base™ Automatic Dirt Disposal, 2 Dirt Disposal Bags
